com.angryelectron.fona

Interface FonaEventHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Fona

    public interface FonaEventHandler
    Handle asynchronous ("unsolicited") events like incoming calls and SMS messages and module status changes. Implement this interface in your application, then attach it using Fona.open(java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer, com.angryelectron.fona.FonaEventHandler).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onError(java.lang.String message)
      Called when an error is encountered while handling unsolicited events.
      void onNetworkStatusChange(Fona.Network status)
      Called whenever the network registration status changes.
      void onSerialReady()
      Called after boot/reset to indicate the serial interface is ready.
      void onSmsMessageReceived(FonaSmsMessage message)
      Called when a new SMS message is received.

    • Method Detail

      • onSmsMessageReceived

        void onSmsMessageReceived(FonaSmsMessage message)
        Called when a new SMS message is received.
        Parameters:
        message - SMS message details.

      • onError

        void onError(java.lang.String message)
        Called when an error is encountered while handling unsolicited events.
        Parameters:
        message - Error message.

      • onSerialReady

        void onSerialReady()
        Called after boot/reset to indicate the serial interface is ready. This event is used internally, so does not need to be implemented for normal operation, but is provided should an application have a need for it.

      • onNetworkStatusChange

        void onNetworkStatusChange(Fona.Network status)
        Called whenever the network registration status changes. This event is used internally, so does not need to be implemented for normal operation, but is provided should an application have a need for it.
        Parameters:
        status - The updated network status.
